alert.note: Alert for Hudspeth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 16 at 3:01PM CDT until October 16 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Texas, including the following county, Hudspeth. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 200 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Southeast of Canyon. Between 1 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Southeast of Canyon is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southern Hudspeth County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
